symptoms.name: Skin lesions
symptoms.severity: Progressing to deep-seated, hard, black eschars
symptoms.pattern: Macular, papular, vesicular, pustular, ulceral, and eschar stages over 2 weeks

symptoms.name: Localized lesion
symptoms.pattern: Mainly on fingers, hands, or face (in immunocompetent individuals)

physical_findings: Lesions on swollen red extremities, body, face, and vulva
Lesions at the same stage of development

lab_values.IgM antibodies: High titer at admission, low after 60 days
lab_values.IgG antibodies: Low avidity at admission, high after 60 days

risk_factors: Contact with infected animals (dogs, potentially from wild rodents)

required: Polymerase chain reaction (PCR) positive for orthopoxvirus
Presence of IgM and low-avidity IgG antibodies
